detached particles that are part of the lexeme

no stress on formatives.

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: MW would code it as “1”

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: Preverb complex and aux. both separable, both at least semiwords (77% words).
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: up to 3 phonological & prosodic words:  preverb complex; verb complex; auxiliary

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: See above.  Word order is strict, so movability isn’t a criterion.  MAN appears to be positioned relative to subject, not to verb.  (This is especially clear in Koroboro Senni, where word order is S MAN O V.)
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: MAN (mood/aspect/negation) and future are separate words.
Preverbal isolating formatives (TAM, chiefly) have their own tones.  Each piece of bipartite stem has its own tone.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: Object is W. position clitic (or can be).
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: NB: Object is W. position clitic (or can be), but when it’s cliticized to the verb that is phonologically coherent.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: No evidence otherwise.
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: No evidence otherwise.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: Obj. and Adv. can intervene between V and the postposed aspect aux., illoc. force markers and suffixal part of circumfixed NEG
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: all formatives are isolating

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: (with few exceptions, cf. Russell 1999:210)
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: prefixes and preverb vs. rest; each preverb = PrWd, person prefix part of this PrWd
PrWd boundary after sf2 (plural -pi) position.
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: Moprhologically sensitive phonology all the way through the suffix string.

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: S/O agreement marker cliticizes to aspect formative, and the combination forms a phonologically separate word.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: ideophones can intervene between V and TAM (p9)
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: except monomoraic (AGR) formatives, all elements are isolating

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: No mention of anything moving, intervening, etc.
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: One accent per word.
External sandhi shifting word boundaries cutting across the grammatical word. Noonan p. 36, 42

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: as a result of separable preverbs

presumably

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: Provisionally judged on the basis of Borgman’s use of spaces.
Preverbs, quantificational elements and incorporates are word-like (Rice 2000: 34)
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: conflicting evidence. In some regards, preverbs, quantificational elements and incorporates pattern with the rest (Rice 2000: 34)

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: Verb can have an [empty?] auxiliary to which some of the inflectional formatives attach.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: p. 134: no permutation, no isolatable parts
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: The verb is incoherent prosodically, ie wrt stress (p125f)
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: The verb word is coherent morphophonologically; it is the domain of internal sandhi (p108f)

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: Some verbs require suffixes to suffix to a support verb fe ‘do’, splitting the verb form into two words (p77)
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: as per default. The grammare is silent as to phonological wordhood.
6 slots, about 4 of them inflectional, are postposed isolating formatives.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: Tense [gramm_marker ID #479] in Wackernagel position obligatory in all and only verb-headed clauses (not with copulas and nominal predicates); other fillers of this position are more like auxiliaries;
Separated NEG morpheme at right edge of VP in some TA categories
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: isolating TAM/AGR markers
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: isolating TAM/AGR markers

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: TAM particles are stressed together with their host, i.e. they are clitics.  But postpositive particles are separate
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: TAM particles are not part of initial reduplication domain; postpositive particles are separate

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: But also including the case/article particle te ‘nonnominative’ when it is part of the VP.
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: Except for initial reduplication which only affects material after the agreement prefixes (other prefixes, root). (p 300f)

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: Some particles are clause final

because agreement is through wackernagel clitics

One of the treatments of bipartite stems (or incorporated stems, or whatever they are) inflects the two pieces separately; Ferrell writes each as a separate word.

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: One stress per inflected verb form.  (Wallis 1964.)

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: There are TAM particles but their occurrence is not bound to a verb, and they are optional.
Negation is part of verb inflectional but includes a clause-final particle!

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: isolating formatives are separately intoned words in most cases (plus a few clitics)
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: see above:  separate phonological words

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: Formatives are mostly isolating.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: There is something Kroeker calls an auxiliary, but it looks like a suffix.
The A + aspect piece may have some syntactic wordhood properties; uncertain.
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: A prefix plus aspect suffix is a separate piece, before the verb (clause-initial?).

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: The A-agreement marker can cliticize to a preceding NP (subject or non-subject); it can also cliticize to the verb

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: at least no evidence against this.
VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: optional word pauses [5]
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: most morphemes trigger epenthetic vowel insertion between C+C. They all cliticize to the first morpheme.

VerbSyntacticCoherencyNotes: Agreement is wackernagel clitic

VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: Floating isolating formatives for many of the verb categories.

A pause can be taken after the incorporated nominals and before the verb stem (Evans 2003:329)
Watters’ (2004: 49) description suggests that prefixes or prefixes and the stem may form a tonal domain (a so-called tonal compound) that does not include the suffix string)
The prosodic domain of a word is extended when it hosts a clitic
VerbPhonologicalCoherencyNotes: MW: I found no evidence for a coherent phonological word domain that spans over the entire verbal complex. Stress apparently only plays a minor role in the phonology of Wadu Pumi, and tone is a phenomenon of the phrase rather than the word. Moreover, directional prefixes and stems form a domain that excludes suffixes, which suggests that there is at least one phonological domain that only comprises part of the predicate complex.

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: Periphrastic construction consisting of two stress domains [TODO @ Manuel add pages]

VerbProsodicCoherencyNotes: Maybe; the tone of the subject pronoun as affected by that of the verb stem (73).

Subject pronoun attracts one or another proclitic from the verb, and the two form a single prosodic unit which is a distinct prosodic unit from the (rest of the) verb.
